{{Taxobox
| name = Bluefish image = Pomatomus saltatrix.png image_width = image_caption
| = regnum = Animalia phylum = Chordata classis = Actinopterygii ordo =
| Perciformes subordo = Percoidei superfamilia = Percoidea familia =
| 'Pomatomidae' genus = 'Pomatomus' genus_authority = Lacépède, 1802 species =
| 'P. saltatrix' binomial = Pomatomus saltatrix binomial_authority =
| (Linnaeus, 1766)
}}

The 'bluefish' (Pomatomus saltatrix) is the only extant species of the family
Pomatomidae. It is a marine pelagic fish found around the world in temperate and
sub-tropical waters, except for the Northern Pacific Ocean. Bluefish are known
as 'tailor' in Australia,<ref>[http://www.marine.csiro.au/caabsearch/caab_searc-
h.caab_report?spcode=37334002 CAAB taxon report for Pomatomus saltatrix] at the
CSIRO</ref> 'shad' on the east coast of South Africa, 'elf' on the west coast,
() or () in Modern Greek, and similarly, 'lüfer'<ref>See Turkisk Vikipedi,
http://tr.wikipedia.org/wiki/L%C3%BCfer; also see, http://www.treehugger.com/green-food/istanbul-celebrates-new-hope-for-a-
favorite-fish-with-first-annual-la14fer-festival.html</ref> in Turkish and
'луфарь/lufar' in Russian. Other common names are blue, chopper, and
anchoa.<ref> {{cite web
| url = http://www.landbigfish.com/fish/fish.cfm?ID=49 title = Bluefish
| Identification accessdate = 2009-02-17
}}</ref> It is good eating and a popular gamefish.

The bluefish is a moderately proportioned fish, with a broad, forked tail. The
spiny first dorsal fin is normally folded back in a groove, as are its pectoral
fins. Coloration is a grayish blue-green dorsally, fading to white on the lower
sides and belly. Its single row of teeth in each jaw are uniform in size, knife-
edged and sharp. Bluefish commonly range in size from seven-inch (18-cm)
"snappers" to much larger, sometimes weighing as much as 40 pounds (18 kg),
though fish heavier than 20 pounds (9 kg) are exceptional.
wiki.title: Bluefish
